verse.roman:
tad vijñāya mahā-sattvo
bhīmaḥ praharatāṁ varaḥ
gṛhītvā pādayoḥ śatruṁ
pātayām āsa bhū-tale

synonyms: tat—that; vijñāya—understanding; mahā—great; sattvaḥ—whose strength; bhīmaḥ—Bhīma; praharatām—of fighters; varaḥ—the best; gṛhītvā—seizing; pādayoḥ—by the feet; śatrum—his enemy; pātayām asa—he made him fall; bhū-tale—to the ground.
translation: Understanding this sign, mighty Bhīma, the best of fighters, seized his opponent by the feet and threw him to the ground.
